description:
A New Year party is not a New Year party without lemonade! As usual, you are expecting a lot of guests, and buying lemonade has already become a pleasant necessity.</br>
Your favorite store sells lemonade in bottles of n different volumes at different costs. A single bottle of type i has volume 2^(i-1) litres and costs ci roubles. The number of bottles of each type in the store can be considered infinite.</br>
You want to buy at least L litres of lemonade. How many roubles do you have to spend?

#### `Input:`

`The input consists of two integers n and L.` 

`1 ≤ n ≤ 30` 

`1 ≤ L ≤ 10^9`



```
the number of types of bottles in the store and the required amount of lemonade in litres, respectively.

n integers c1, c2, ..., cn (`1 ≤ ci ≤ 10^9`) — the costs of bottles of different types.
```

#### `Output:`

`Output a single integer — the smallest number of roubles you have to pay to buy at least L litres of lemonade.`


#### `Example 1:`

#### `Input:`
```
4 12
20 30 70 90
```
#### `Output:`
```
150
```
#### `Explanation:`</br>

`You should buy one 8-litre bottle for 90 roubles and two 2-litre bottles for 30 roubles each. In total, you'll get 12 litres of lemonade for just 150 roubles.`
#### `Example 2:`</br>
#### `Input:`
```
4 3
10000 1000 100 10
```
**Output**:
```
10
```
#### `Explanation:`</br>

```

Even though you need only 3 litres, it's cheaper to buy a single 8-litre bottle for 10 roubles.
```
title: Minimum Cost for New Year Lemonade Party
